# Shayan Eskandari

> Security researcher, human-centered technologist, and educator working at the intersection of technology and humanity.

## About

Shayan Eskandari is a senior security engineer, blockchain researcher, and post-doctoral fellow at NOVA SBE (Portugal). He holds a PhD from Concordia University on "Uncovering Blockchain Challenges: Technical Nuances and Their Unforeseen Consequences." His work spans smart contract auditing, censorship circumvention tools, AI-driven development, and the responsible application of decentralized technology. He is co-founder of Creed, a Web3 security firm, and Rebellion Systems, A ZK company. 

## Philosophy

The intersection of technology and humanity requires constant vigilance. As we build the future, we must ensure it serves human flourishing rather than diminishing it. Every project reflects a commitment to transparency, security, and responsible technology development.

## Key Pages

- [About](https://shayan.es/about/): Professional background, journey highlights, and areas of expertise
- [Career](https://shayan.es/career/): Full professional experience and work history
- [Security Audits](https://shayan.es/audits/): Portfolio of 50+ smart contract and DeFi security audits
- [Research & Publications](https://shayan.es/scholar/): Academic papers on blockchain security, oracle manipulation, front-running, and cryptojacking
- [Projects](https://shayan.es/projects/): Open-source tools including MoaV (censorship circumvention), retroMaid (ROM metadata scraper), Legions (Web3 Node security toolkit) and more
- [Apps](https://shayan.es/apps/): Software applications including Nedagram (text-over-sound), PadSnap, and other tools
- [Talks & Media](https://shayan.es/talks/): Conference presentations, podcasts, workshops, and panels
- [Art](https://shayan.es/art/): Digital art exploring technology and human creativity
- [Connect](https://shayan.es/connect/): Contact and social profiles

## Expertise

- Smart contract security auditing and risk assessment
- Blockchain technology (Ethereum, Bitcoin, staking, DeFi)
- Censorship circumvention and privacy tools
- AI-driven full-stack development
- Academic research in decentralized systems
- Education, mentorship, and public speaking
